A few people brought this up when discussing Jax without the League a while back as him being some kind of important Ionian figure, perhaps a master martial artist or guardian of some kind that was roused to come to the forefront when Noxus invaded Ionia.

I love this theory so much, especially since it gives an excuse for him to keep the lamppost without the Institute of War to impose restrictions. It also helps to explain how Ionia managed to repel Noxus, a numerically superior nation with mercenary assistance from Zaun. Ionia's greatest legends came to the island nation's defense.

It's one of the things I actually really like from World of Warcraft; the legendary creatures of the world actually come and fight alongside mortals during the darkest times. There are quest-lines revolving around helping those ancient beings out and them fighting alongside them in battle, and with folks like Soraka, Bard and potentially Jax and Ao Shin, I feel a similar vibe; Ionia needs some help, and so the legends of old come around again to give it a hand, and show these invading Noxians just what they were messing with! To me it's almost as if when things like this happen, it's like everything unites for a common goal; people aren't cowering, praying to their gods and guardians, they're fighting alongside those gods and guardians!

Also adds an interesting vibe for me to the Noxus - Ionia conflict: "You brought mercenaries and technology from Zaun? Well we brought guardians of natural and interstellar beings!" Perhaps this is how they plan to resolve the conflict completely since Noxus hasn't been booted out yet, I mean what better way to send a message to your enemies than literally having your gods come around and slap them in the face?

Just an opinion, you guys can open up the thuth to me if I'm wrong, but

Bard's E and R seem useless, Whats the purpose of E of enemy's can go through? And R does no dmg, and if you do land it, you can't do any dmg to them since their in a "stasis"... It's like {{champion:127}}  ult, or a free{{item:3157}} for them...

Please don't downvote, explain it...

Magical Journey is a very powerful tool; sure, enemies can go through it, but would you really be willing to follow Bard through a wall when you can't see what is on the other side? Best case scenario, it's just Bard trying to escape. Worst case, the entire team is waiting for you to take the bait after Bard Q's you to the wall you come out of, or any teammates following you. Conversely, Bard can use it to grant otherwise immobile champions a way to instantly dive the enemy's backline. Imagine your team is trying to take Baron/Dragon. Suddenly, a portal appears behind the objective... and out pops Annie with a Tibber's stun ready. The rest of his team immediately follows while everyone is reeling from a flaming, bear hug.

Tempered Fate is exactly what it's name implies, an ability that can change the course of the game from any position on the map. Picture two teams waiting to engage, one hugging their tower, the other looking for an opening. With little warning, Bard ults the team trying to dive. For a few precious seconds, no one can move or be hurt. It doesn't seem like much, until you see his team getting into optimal position for a wombo-combo. Orianna puts her ball on Udyr who casually strolls into the middle of the team. The second Bard's ult wears off, boom.

In terms of his R, I'll give you some scenarios.

"Okay we have to engage on the enemy so they can't just run away as soon as Amumu gets here. Oh crap, I think we might be f$%^&, R!" Amumu comes in, q's to the enemy and ults just as the stasis wears off, giving Bard and his ADC the chance to finish them off before they can do the same to them.

"Oh no, Veigar just got ulted by Zed and he's about to die when it goes off! R!" Veigar turns invincible just before the mark goes off, allowing him to survive.

"Ugh, we can win, I know we can, we just need to get to their ADC, but we can't get past the frontline.... R!" R's the enemy frontline, allowing his frontline to engage on the ADC and kill them before their team comes out of stasis.
